column4: while using XFCE i chose a dodgey skin and it crashes and i cannot find away to change skins back without the skin box crashing it happend on gnome aswel
sounds recursive.  if no one chimes in with a better solution, i'd try mv or rm the dodgy skin file, then trying again
What does mv or rm mean?
ok cool, how do i execute them?
mv oldname newname, or rm oldname
i don't know the name of it its like ivallbook or something i cant remeber the full name and i cant see it because it crashes
what ebone said :)  i was presuming you were in console since it seems your gui wouldn't work now
applications > system tools > terminal, if you can get there
yeah, similar enough for now at least :)
i can't move the skin because i don't know the name of it
yes, and i don't know enough about skins to know where to look for it .... here's a very brute-force means i guess: ls -r | less, then scroll through until you see a filename that looks familiar?
tree | less, if you have tree on that box
do you know how to take a screen shot on XFCE?
no sorry, i don't think i've ever used it
